title: Drawing, Design for  Side Serving Table displaying a Vase of China, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for  Side Serving Table displaying a Vase of China
medium: Pen and black ink on thin, cream paper
inscribed: In black ink, lower right: "SIDE TABLE/ 6'.0" long"; In black ink, to left of vase with a pointing arrow: "vase of  CHINA".  In graphite, at left side of sheet: "MXS"; at lower left  bottom edge: "A"
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Table surface (with curved skirting) and back splash supported by four cabriole legs joined by four scrolling stretchers supporting an elaborate urn-shaped vase on a pedestal.  Back splash is decorated with three-plumed carving at center, and scrolls on each side.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for  Side Serving Table displaying a Vase of China, 1900–05. Pen and black ink on thin, cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-96
